page.title: 16STOKE BRUERNE (CANAL CENTRE)
page.content: STOKE BRUERNE IS SMALLER THAN ROADE AND HAS NO PROPER GROCERS SHOP.IT HAS A RESTAURANT A PUB AND TWO GIFT SHOPS. THERE ARE NO FACTORIES OR OTHER PLACES OF WORK . THE ONLY JOBS ARE CONNECTED WITH THE TOURIST TRADE ON THE CANAL. THERE IS A WATERWAYS MUSEUM WHICH SHOWS WHAT LIFE WAS LIKE IN THE OLD DAYS WHEN THE CANAL WAS USED FOR CARRYING COAL AND OTHER GOODS. THERE ARE BOAT TRIPS THROUGH BLISWORTH TUNNEL OR TO COSGROVE. THE CENTRE OF STOKE IS MOSTLY OLD STONE COTTAGES,A FEW ARE THATCHED. THERE ARE SOME NEW HOUSES NEAR THE EDGE OF THE VILLAGE. THERE IS A VILLAGE SCHOOL WITH ABOUT 50 PUPILS. ( BY SIMON JAMIESON )
